DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient._The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
